intro: Stypandra glauca var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stypandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It is a small shrub that produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible for certain native animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
